.  The Taupo Volcanic Zone runs through the Bay of Plenty from the active

in the north-east. Here the earth's crust is believed to be only 5 km thick in places.  There are several other large, though dormant, volcanoes in this zone, including the volcanic calderas currently occupied by Lakes Taupo and Rotorua, as well as the more familiar volcanic cones.
